page.title: 07Seismic survey near Consall
page.content: Horizon Oil Co. conducted a seismic survey in the Consall area to search for oil. They brought delicate electronic instruments and crews of men into the small village. The first person who came was a representive obtaining permission for the survey. Then the survey crew came to find out where to put the listening devices and then the geophones. The information was transmitted by wire to the recording truck. Electronic instruments recorded the waves for computer analysis. The waves were generated by big vehicle mounted vibrators. The vibrating took about 30 seconds at each point. After the survey finished the crew tidied up and left. Now the villagers just have to wait for them to analyse the information and then to tell them whether there is oil at Consall.
